**Review by [gaya thiri](https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/118337874266051480623/reviews?hl=en)**  
Rating: ‚≠ê 1.0  
Location: Reliance digital tamil nadu

Reviewed: 2 months ago  
Caption: This is probably not going to make a dent, and I don't usually leave bad reviews, but had a terrible experience here.  Asked for a travel adapter/universal plug, they said they didn't have it. Then asked for a type-C charger. Got the most high-powered one (80W) for 999 Rs. My laptop only needs 65W to charge.  Asked to test the charger after buying. Sales assistant tried 3 power points and it didn't work. Then they blamed me for not telling them that I bought the Type C charger to charge my laptop. 4 of their staff (2 men, one of whom was quite senior, and 2 ladies) ganged up on me and said it was my fault that I didn't tell them that the charger was for my laptop? It didn't occur to me because all my type C phone chargers (Samsung, Pixel, etc.) are used to charge my laptop back where I am from. I asked them why they didn't sensitise me to this issue about compatibility since I wouldn't know that type C chargers are not interchangeable in India. I even said, "this is just a communication breakdown because you didn't ask what this charger was for and I didn't tell what it was for, and no one is to be blamed, so why are you blaming me for this?"  It was hard to have a conversation when it was 4 vs. 1. Talking turned into yelling, and they refused to give me an exchange or refund. They didn't even apologise for the situation and instead continued yelling at me that it was my fault for not telling them in advance. How would I know that an 80W charger wouldn't work on a 65W laptop?????  Marched out of the shop without a charger and 999 Rs. short. Awful people, awful at handling their customers. Ganging up on me was completely unnecessary and in bad taste. Will never return.

**Review by [gaya thiri](https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/118337874266051480623/reviews?hl=en)**  
Rating: ‚≠ê 1.0  
Location: Reliance digital tamil nadu

Reviewed: 2 months ago  
Caption: This is probably not going to make a dent, and I don't usually leave bad reviews, but had a terrible experience here.  Asked for a travel adapter/universal plug, they said they didn't have it. Then asked for a type-C charger. Got the most high-powered one (80W) for 999 Rs. My laptop only needs 65W to charge.  Asked to test the charger after buying. Sales assistant tried 3 power points and it didn't work. Then they blamed me for not telling them that I bought the Type C charger to charge my laptop. 4 of their staff (2 men, one of whom was quite senior, and 2 ladies) ganged up on me and said it was my fault that I didn't tell them that the charger was for my laptop? It didn't occur to me because all my type C phone chargers (Samsung, Pixel, etc.) are used to charge my laptop back where I am from. I asked them why they didn't sensitise me to this issue about compatibility since I wouldn't know that type C chargers are not interchangeable in India. I even said, "this is just a communication breakdown because you didn't ask what this charger was for and I didn't tell what it was for, and no one is to be blamed, so why are you blaming me for this?"  It was hard to have a conversation when it was 4 vs. 1. Talking turned into yelling, and they refused to give me an exchange or refund. They didn't even apologise for the situation and instead continued yelling at me that it was my fault for not telling them in advance. How would I know that an 80W charger wouldn't work on a 65W laptop?????  Marched out of the shop without a charger and 999 Rs. short. Awful people, awful at handling their customers. Ganging up on me was completely unnecessary and in bad taste. Will never return.

Caption: We had bought 2 split AC from the store for my grandparents home. At the time of booking they assured us they will look over the installation smoothly. But when my grandfather went to pay and did not have 50 rupees change they were very rude and were very reluctant to let go away of 50 rupees only. Moreover on the time of installation they did not even provide with a three pin plug, a remote holder and even a thing as simple as remote cells. And they expected my grandfather to arrange a 3 pin plug as if he knows every electrician in town.  This kind of service is not expected from a shop that comes under the tag of Reliance group. Very disappointed.

Caption: Good experience till you buy. You are on your own once you buy from here.  I bought a Eureka Forbes vacuum cleaner from here in April 2024 and in 2 months it stopped working. Half of the warranty period is completed in the service centre as well. I asked them for a warranty replacement which they refused to do.  I got a number of service manager who also give the same route answer that he will check and update but I don't get any update or communication.  Terrible and unprofessional after sale experience  Update on 17-10-2024: Following the response from Reliance Digital to email cshead.reliancedigital@ril.com with all the details for a resolution, I did the same and registered a complaint ( Complaint No - 701351127). I'm receiving the same update on email as well that the part is not available, will provide an update soon though the product is with them since the last 3 months. There is no concrete update or a date for resolution, a warranty replacement or a refund. Contacting the Reliance ResQ manager or emailing cshead.reliancedigital@ril.com is a futile exercise. Probably I'll file a case with consumer court as a last resort.

I opened the box and made a video, only to find that the TV stand was missing. When I called the store, they said the stand would not come with the TV and would arrive separately with the technician.  Later, I received a call from the technician, who told me he was on his way, so I canceled a meeting and waited at home. After two hours, I called him again, and he claimed I had given the wrong address and said someone else would come the next day.  They wasted my entire day. If you‚Äôre planning to buy anything from this store, think twice about their after-sales service and support. Rather he shamelessly told me to go to Gujarat and get it change. I made personal efforts and arranged a green sim. When i visited this outlet again to process sim change, they asked me to pay 25/- for the sim which i personally arranged. This is the level of arrogance. Reliance Jio and outlet owner should take charge staff behavior. You have such an expensive property at prime location, but i am sure due to staff attitude you must be in loss not in profit.

Caption: Not deserved for a single Star.  I recently visited this Store for portability to Jio. He has taken details viz Aadhar, UPC code and clicked my photo in his mobile. After this, he asked me to recharge Rs. 239 pack or 299. I told him I want  a pack having more validity period.  He refused and told me only these packs are available.  I tried to contact Jio Customer Care,  but could not succeed. Finally I agreed to recharge 239 pack. He repeatedly insisted for cash, but I don't have cash with me. The Store's name is Reliance Digital Xpress,  but there was no digital payment mode.  I had to pay this amount (asked to pay 240 in place of 239) to his Google Pay account.  After leaving the Store, I talked to Jio Customer Care where they told me Customer can choose any pack as first recharge.  On seeing his rude attitude, I planned to go to Airtel Store. Unfortunately, their Store llocation reflected much far away.  If such person is in Jio Store,  much customers may swich over to other competitors. Jio should teach their staff how to deal with their customers to avoid business loss.

Caption: Not deserved for a single Star.  I recently visited this Store for portability to Jio. He has taken details viz Aadhar, UPC code and clicked my photo in his mobile. After this, he asked me to recharge Rs. 239 pack or 299. I told him I want  a pack having more validity period.  He refused and told me only these packs are available.  I tried to contact Jio Customer Care,  but could not succeed. Finally I agreed to recharge 239 pack. He repeatedly insisted for cash, but I don't have cash with me. The Store's name is Reliance Digital Xpress,  but there was no digital payment mode.  I had to pay this amount (asked to pay 240 in place of 239) to his Google Pay account.  After leaving the Store, I talked to Jio Customer Care where they told me Customer can choose any pack as first recharge.  On seeing his rude attitude, I planned to go to Airtel Store. Unfortunately, their Store llocation reflected much far away.  If such person is in Jio Store,  much customers may swich over to other competitors. Jio should teach their staff how to deal with their customers to avoid business loss.

I visited the Reliance Digital store at Lakemall today to compare the camera quality of the iPhone 15 Pro and Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra. I requested to have one of the phones unlocked so I could take photos and videos for comparison kept together at same place in rhe store. However, the staffs informed me that they couldn't unlock the devices because doing so would trigger a security alarm and they won't be able to stop that and even the manager confirmed too.  When I asked for their names, they reiterated that they couldn't assist with unlocking the phones. This lack of support made it difficult for me to assess which phone offers better video quality, impacting my purchasing decision.  Based on this experience, I would recommend against purchasing any products from the Lakemall Reliance Digital store.

Caption: Pls don't visit on the basis of Google ratings that is wasting of uour time. I visited the Reliance Digital store at Lakemall today to compare the camera quality of the iPhone 15 Pro and Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra. I requested to have one of the phones unlocked so I could take photos and videos for comparison kept together at same place in rhe store. However, the staffs informed me that they couldn't unlock the devices because doing so would trigger a security alarm and they won't be able to stop that and even the manager confirmed too.  When I asked for their names, they reiterated that they couldn't assist with unlocking the phones. This lack of support made it difficult for me to assess which phone offers better video quality, impacting my purchasing decision.  Based on this experience, I would recommend against purchasing any products from the Lakemall Reliance Digital store.

With my warranty nearing expiration, I finally managed to get the compressor replaced. The AC worked for a few months, but starting October 24, it wouldn‚Äôt even turn on. A technician informed me that the PCB was faulty and asked for payment for the replacement and a visit, which I hadn‚Äôt been informed about in advance.  Fortunately, I remembered that the PCB has a five-year warranty, and I confirmed this on Samsung's website. Despite this, I still haven‚Äôt received confirmation from Reliance that they will honor the warranty and replace the PCB. Location: Reliance digital mumbai

Reviewed: 2 days ago  
Caption: I purchased an HP Envy Ryzen 7 laptop on June 2, 2023, from the Reliance Digital store at Infinity Mall, Malad West, with an extended warranty for two years. The salesperson assured me that the warranty would also cover accidental damage. However, just after one year (on June 6, 2024), the left hinge of my laptop jammed, causing screen damage.  I contacted the same store, only to be informed by a senior representative that accidental damage wasn‚Äôt covered under the warranty, despite the previous assurance.  I was asked to get a repair quotation from the HP Service Center at Goregaon East (ORAREGA), which I later found is internally connected with Reliance Digital, likely to deceive customers. The service person took one look at my laptop without even opening it and promised to send me a quotation in three days.  When I received the quotation, I was shocked. They claimed the laptop was "100% damaged" and the repair cost would exceed the purchase price of ‚Çπ93,000. My laptop was still functioning at that point, with only a damaged screen and jammed hinges.  Reliance Digital then suggested involving an insurance company called Oriented Services, asking me to send my laptop to their team in Delhi for repair. After over a month of struggle, they finally agreed to repair it but claimed the cost would be ‚Çπ60,500, out of which I had to pay ‚Çπ10,500. I had no other option and agreed.  After four months of waiting, I finally got my laptop back on October 14, 2024. But the nightmare didn‚Äôt end there. They had replaced my original Ryzen 7 keyboard with one from a Ryzen 5 model, which now prevents me from using features like auto brightness and dark mode. I suspect they sold my original keyboard to someone else.  Throughout this ordeal, I sent more than 15 emails to the CEO of Reliance Digital, but there was no proper or tracking response. The lack of control over their insurance and repair companies shows either gross negligence or an intentional scam to increase profits.  I haven‚Äôt received an original repair bill, and the whole process lacked transparency. This entire experience has been nothing short of a scam, and I urge anyone considering buying from Reliance Digital to demand all promises in writing before making a purchase. Attaching *after keyboard* and *before keyboard* and damaged photos of product which you can understand how much it was damaged.

I purchased a Samsung WindFree AC (AR18CY3AMWK) from Reliance Digital on June 25, 2023. Initially, I didn‚Äôt use it much because it started raining right after my purchase. However, when I finally used the AC, it produced a lot of noise, which my neighbor also complained about. I repeatedly called Reliance Digital's customer care, spending hours on hold with no response.  After months of trying to reach them, I called the Reliance Digital store where I bought the AC. They answered quickly and sent a technician, who dismissed my concerns, saying, ‚ÄúThis AC is supposed to be noisy; there‚Äôs no problem.‚Äù  Frustrated, I called a third-party technician, who informed me that the compressor was not functioning properly. With my warranty nearing expiration, I finally managed to get the compressor replaced. The AC worked for a few months, but starting October 24, it wouldn‚Äôt even turn on. A technician informed me that the PCB was faulty and asked for payment for the replacement and a visit, which I hadn‚Äôt been informed about in advance.  Fortunately, I remembered that the PCB has a five-year warranty, and I confirmed this on Samsung's website. Despite this, I still haven‚Äôt received confirmation from Reliance that they will honor the warranty and replace the PCB. The heat has been unbearable lately, and my inflammation has returned, leading to the need for medical attention.  I highly recommend avoiding Reliance Digital for any purchases!

**Review by [Pradeep Ghorpade](https://www.google.com/maps/contrib/107515854372097385018/reviews?hl=en)**  
Rating: ‚≠ê 1.0  
Location: Reliance digital mumbai

Reviewed: 2 days ago  
Caption: I purchased an HP Envy Ryzen 7 laptop on June 2, 2023, from the Reliance Digital store at Infinity Mall, Malad West, with an extended warranty for two years. The salesperson assured me that the warranty would also cover accidental damage. However, just after one year (on June 6, 2024), the left hinge of my laptop jammed, causing screen damage.  I contacted the same store, only to be informed by a senior representative that accidental damage wasn‚Äôt covered under the warranty, despite the previous assurance.  I was asked to get a repair quotation from the HP Service Center at Goregaon East (ORAREGA), which I later found is internally connected with Reliance Digital, likely to deceive customers. The service person took one look at my laptop without even opening it and promised to send me a quotation in three days.  When I received the quotation, I was shocked. They claimed the laptop was "100% damaged" and the repair cost would exceed the purchase price of ‚Çπ93,000. My laptop was still functioning at that point, with only a damaged screen and jammed hinges.  Reliance Digital then suggested involving an insurance company called Oriented Services, asking me to send my laptop to their team in Delhi for repair. After over a month of struggle, they finally agreed to repair it but claimed the cost would be ‚Çπ60,500, out of which I had to pay ‚Çπ10,500. I had no other option and agreed.  After four months of waiting, I finally got my laptop back on October 14, 2024. But the nightmare didn‚Äôt end there. They had replaced my original Ryzen 7 keyboard with one from a Ryzen 5 model, which now prevents me from using features like auto brightness and dark mode. I suspect they sold my original keyboard to someone else.  Throughout this ordeal, I sent more than 15 emails to the CEO of Reliance Digital, but there was no proper or tracking response. The lack of control over their insurance and repair companies shows either gross negligence or an intentional scam to increase profits.  I haven‚Äôt received an original repair bill, and the whole process lacked transparency. This entire experience has been nothing short of a scam, and I urge anyone considering buying from Reliance Digital to demand all promises in writing before making a purchase.
